content.description: In some works of literature, a dream or vision experienced by a character initiates a series of events as the character attempts to decipher its meaning and respond appropriately. These events often establish or illuminate a conflict within the narrative. Either from your own reading or from the list below, choose a work of fiction in which a character’s experience of a dream or vision sets such a sequence of events in motion. Then, in a well-written essay, analyze how the series of events creates or reveals conflict and contributes to an interpretation of the work as a whole. Do not merely summarize the plot. In your response you should do the following: Respond to the prompt with a thesis that presents a defensible interpretation. Provide evidence to support your line of reasoning. Explain how the evidence supports your line of reasoning. Use appropriate grammar and punctuation in communicating your argument. The Agüero Sisters The Alchemist Angels In America Beloved Bless Me, Ultima Death of a Salesman Dreaming in Cuban Frankenstein The House of the Spirits Invisible Man Jane Eyre Klara and the Sun Macbeth Marisol Middle Passage A Midsummer Night’s Dream The Miraculous Day of Amalia Gómez The Night Watchman Northanger Abbey One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest The Piano Lesson The Picture of Dorian Gray The Plague of Doves Praisesong for the Widow A Prayer for Owen Meany Rebecca Sing, Unburied, Sing Slaughterhouse-Five The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde Swamplandia! The Turn of the Screw Trinity Sight A Visitation of Spirits Wide Sargasso Sea The Woman Warrior Wuthering Heights

frqParts.text: In a well-written essay, analyze how the series of events creates or reveals conflict and contributes to an interpretation of the work as a whole.

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain the function of a significant event or related set of significant events in a plot.
